body.name: imarku Japanese Chef Knife - Sharp Kitchen Knife 8 Inch Chef's Knives HC Steel Paring Knife, Unique Gifts for Men and Women, Gifts for Mom or Dad, Kitchen Gadgets with Premium Gift Box
features: High-Carbon Stainless Steel Blade- It is manufactured from high-quality stainless steel that maintains its functionality for a long time. And to boost its sturdiness, the steel contains 0.6-0.75 carbon. This makes it two times as hard as other knives in its class as they contain about 0.3% carbon.

Multi-functional Knife- The gyutou knife is classified and designed to be a multipurpose knife for professional applications. It cuts, dices, slices, chops and also cuts meat off bones. It comes with a HRC( Rockwell Hardness Scale) of 56-58 which makes it among the tough knives in its class.

Ergonomic Pakka Handle- To make it more professional and minimize any fatigue, finger numbness or aches after holding it continuously for an extended time the knife's handle is made from Pakka. This is material that originates from Africa and its known for its comfort, strength and stability.

Ultra-sharp Edge- Sharpness is key to achieving the best cuts and this is evident in the knife's blade which is quite sharp and will remain this way even after tough tasks such as cutting tough meat or removing flesh from bones. The sharpness is further boosted by use of the latest Japanese engineering.

Corrosion Resistance Stainless Blade- In addition to carbon, 16-18% chrome is also included in the blade's metal composition. This gives its a glossy finish which will not tarnish even after using it for a long time, they are perfect mothers day gifts, christmas gifts, wedding and birthday gifts. We offer our customers a no-hassle refund within 3 months and a lifetime warranty on these knives.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: imarku--Cook Better! Live Better! PHANTOM SERIES KITCHEN KNIVES imarku has been a professional in kitchen knives for 15 Years. Owning factories allows us to serve the best quality goods to our customers — so you can cook with confidence for decades to come. We keep developing new design kitchen knives to meet more customers' requirements.

Previous page Well- built and Comfortable Combination of Japanese technology and quality materials lead to a reliable knife for varied uses. User-friendly and Ergonomic Good ergonomics minimize the possibility of experiencing aches and cramps on the finger. Strong and Durable Japanese-made knife is strong and can be used in tough tasks Versatile and Classy Suitable for most cutting applications. It‘s also quite classy thanks to its design & chrome finish. Next page 1 HANDLE 2 BLADE 3 BOLSTER 4 EDGE

IMARKU CARE FOR YOU * - It is not suitable for slicing through frozen foods as this may make the blade lose its sharpness. * - The knife isn't designed for use in a hot flame because this may make the protective finish to wear away and give the blade a permanent dull finish. * - The chrome-finish doesn't rust or tarnish easily and requires minimal maintenance. Also, cleaning the knife is as simple as washing with clean water and mild soap. * - Hand washing is recommended and not for dishwasher.

reviews.reviewText: This knife is wonderful! Feels nice and light in my hand, however cuts with precision and easily.

reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Imarku Japanese Chef Knife. Beautiful, Sharp, Balanced, Worth It!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Quality, Chef-Approved Knife
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Sleek, attractive packaging makes it a nice gift. The knife itself has a sturdy, weighty feel—it’s easy to hold & slices beautifully. My husband took it to the chef he works for & he gave it, ‘a solid A’.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent blade, but the handle is lacking.
reviews.reviewText: Knives are sharp and cut excellently as well as holding and edge very well.That said, the finish on the handles started to fail after the first washing and are now just rough wood handles that had to be sanded smooth again and need to be worn in by use.Quality blade, cut corner wood handle. If you don't mind finishing the handle yourself, is an excellent chefs knife. Used daily in professional kitchen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is so easy to use, fits in the hand well, very very sharp

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I use the chef knife every day in my kitchen, and it's become a staple for a couple of simple reasons:It's crazy sharp, making chopping and slicing a whole lot easier. The handle is comfy, so even when I'm prepping a big meal, it feels good in my hand. And honestly, it just powers through everything I throw at it, from veggies to meats.If you're after a reliable knife for everyday cooking without all the fancy sales pitch, this one's a winner. It's just a darn good knife that gets the job done. Highly recommended!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars build quality is great.
reviews.reviewText: Great knife, the handles are great, cuts very well. I have not used them enough to see how long it stays sharp. I recommend this product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This knife is so sharp! Easily cuts everything like butter! I have to be extremely careful because I have already gotten a lot of little cuts on my fingers! As long as you are careful, this is a great knife for the price!&

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I am delighted with this knife. Extremely well made, ergonomically excellent and a delight to use.The expression of a 'Knife through butter' certainly applies to this breadknife.It slices through soft and delicate beread/cakes etc like no other knife I have ever owned.Crusty and sourdough bread similarly present no problems for this quite brilliant knife -I thoroughly recommend !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewText: It is better than I expected. The price is very good for such a quality knife.

Ein Brotmesser wie ich es mir immer schon gewünscht habe.Nachdem das alte begann zu rosten, wurde es ausgemustert und tutnun seinen Dienst im Schuppen weiter. Das neue ist gut verarbeitet,hat ein ordentliches Gewicht, sauscharf und der Wellenschliff istprofessionell. Der Griff ist ergonomisch und angenehm, man könnteihn sogar mit 500er Schleifpapier noch leicht anrauen.Nachtrag am 07.11.2023Was ich heute getan habe, denn der Griff war doch sehr glatt .ich nahm 240er Papier (hatte grad nix anderes zur Hand) und schliffdamit QUER!! zum Griff ringsherum 2 Minuten die polierteOberfläche leicht an. Ging einwandfrei. Danach den Griff kurtz spülenund nun ist er richtig schön griffig und die Haptik ist noch angenehmer alsfrüher. Ich weiß auch nicht, warum die Fernost-Hersteller immer alleslackieren oder polieren müssen, das ist manchmal kontraproduktiv.Nachtrag EndeHabe heute schon mal einige Scheiben eines groben Roggenkastenbrotesgeschnitten und die Klinge verbiegt sich nicht und die Schnitte werdensauber und vor allem GRADE. Der Preis ist fast nicht zu glauben, dafür,daß dieses Messer aus Japan kommen soll und mit deutschem Kohlenstoff-stahl gefertigt sein soll. Na gut egal, ich denke mal es wird irgendwie doch inChina gefertigt worden sein, sonst läßt sich dieser Preis nicht ökonomischdurchsetzen. Vielleicht ist es das Übliche also Design in Japan, Werkstoff Daber Herstellung "Under Control" der Japaner in China. Mir gefällt diese kleinegeriffelte "Samuraischwert" und ich bin bis dahin sehr zufrieden.
